bow: why do we make stay at home moms feel bad recently told my employer that would not be returning in september after the birth of my daughter once word got around started to get questions like what are you going to do all day and don you want to show her women can be more than housewives it incredibly frustrating hearing all of this from coworkers family and friends my husband and made decision that was right for our family never said my career was over just want to take some time off to raise my daughter and be there for every moment is that so wrong it definitely not wrong working mom and feel deep doubt in my choice every day if we had the means would absolutely stay home unfortunately make more money and my husband would be unhappy at home every family should pick what is right for them and anyone who is part of the household should mind their business it not wrong at all escpecially if you live in the us with crappy options for maternity leave stayed home over year and have recently started working again it was the most difficult and rewarding 15 months got to see all his firsts and my son was being raised by his parents not daycare no one should be shared by their decisions whether the mom wants to go right back to work or stay home if mom is happy and able to make such decision then that really is best what is shame is parent being forced to work due to financial needs you do you mom sorry for the rant removed ugh can people say we ll miss you good luck if they can say thing more supportive have the opposite problem feel like no matter what mother do we will always be judged am working mum pump at work and my husband quit his job and is stay at home dad most people told me was abandoning my kid that wouldnt last etc my husband was met with high fives and other men wishing they could do it sorry congrats its great that you are in situation where you can do that chalk up the hate to jealousy and wish them well gt don you want to show her women can be more than housewives well do you want to show your child they are more important to you than some crappy job not saying your job is crappy but tend to get snarky with these kind of comebacks let not forget the flip side here have to work but that does mean my job is more important then my kids we need the money to help pay for our mortgage for groceries for bills for dance class and karate love to be able to stay home with my kids nowadays in the us at least it seems that no matter what women do there is chorus of voices to tell us we re doing it wrong oh absolutely not trying to belittle anyone decision to work or to stay home but think dragging kids into the argument to try and guilt someone into staying at work deserves snarky response happen to be the only sahm in my social circle and do know what is worse the moms who look down on me for giving up my career or the one mom who wishes she could be sahm but ca afford it and is passive aggressively jealous towards me think need new friends absolutely from formula vs breastfeeding to working vs staying home you can do anything just right it so frustrating to hear other people opinions on your parenting especially when they aren even parents if heard this from mom while was at work would offer to get together for lunch whenever taking care of baby can be lonely work gt every family should pick what is right for them and anyone who is part of the household should mind their business this is exactly it stay home mum and have questioned it as well but it works for us it does really affect anyone else so butt out had some old biddy tell me it must be nice to be sahm since get to play games all day there is no shame in the stay at home mom game the only people who ever comment on it are the ones who have never done it had jobs where made more than my hubby and jobs where did when baby came around we always knew we wanted one of us to stay home and we honestly thought it would be him but little did we know at that moment he was making more at job we really loves that could support me staying home you do what works screw people and their unknowing opinions good for you stayed home as much as could working moms are awesome and have hard time sahm are awesome and have hard time we need to lift up instead of tear down its jealousy and people feel too ashamed to just say that or to see if thats an option for them if it works is healthy and your family is happy then youre doing it right gt don you want to show her women can be more than housewives you are showing her that women get to choose what is best for them and their families the beauty of feminism and our rights is that we get the choice no one is forcing you to do this you *want* to do this and that is amazing honestly think it jealousy at having the financial stability to choose to be stay at home parent not everyone has that option and sure there are ton of people who hate their jobs and wish they could afford to stay home with kid or without yes you re also showing that you can sacrifice and budget to make it work seems like not matter what option woman chooses she gets blamed for it by someone it super annoying was going to make the same comment about maternity leave it ridiculous to question someone choice to be sahm regardless of the situation it also ridiculous to pressure someone to stay and then offer only unpaid fmla leave for the mandated 12 weeks then when you do return you come back to inadequate breastfeeding spaces and an inflexible schedule that penalizes you for having an infant in daycare not necessarily applicable to op but this happens all the time in the us and it horrible whenever hear about companies bosses being judgy about sahms always wonder if they truly do support working moms the judgement is never acceptable but find it particularly abhorrent when they make it impossible for you either way it feels like penalty for being woman and having children do worry about those people you will get to see your childs every milestone and trust me they are born then five minutes later they are 10 years old you will enjoy every minute of it oh no get it do love my job teacher but don want to miss out on my daughter especially since this is my first kid my husband stays home with our son too it was decision we made together and the plan was for just one year he loves spending the day with our boy even though it hard work and he exhausted when get home he really happy but his old work buddies ca comprehend it they ve spent the whole year sending him links to job applications and telling him they know guy who knows guy who is looking to fill position blah blah blah they started like weeks after he left his job it like they ca understand why guy would take year off to be with his kid learned this on my maternity leave was so lonely at home with my newborn but also constantly yearned for moment to myself when my husband got home just go and lay down and stare at the walls now that my son is toddling around and he hugs and kisses me and we eat and laugh together it better still exhausted but it more rewarding also went back to work when he was months old and my husband stays home with him now the grown up interactions get at work are such lifeline for my psyche on weekends drag my husband out of the house anywhere just to get him out of baby world it definitely grass looks greener situation my husband and split the year up with one of us being the stay at home parent while the other worked we ve each seen both sides and are now kinder and more conscious of each other feelings and experiences and we still sometimes snap at each other about you think ve just been having fun all day over here we are perfect but it helped that we have done both omg have now ex friend who had this reaction when told her my husband was going to stay home with our baby after my maternity leave happy for you that you have that option it was weird thing to say most people reacted like that ll be great he ll have such great relationship with the baby what great guy she does even have kids guess she was jealous of my job income we are friends anymore mostly because she did seem to like me once got pregnant apparently became really selfish after that would worry about what coworkers say they may have their own personal agenda in order to keep you there if possible show off to the boss etc removed people are silly and do understand the work that goes into taking care of child especially that first year you are either going to do it or pay someone else to do it or you know have family member do it for free someone has to do it it job and taking time off does ruin your career you are right my friend took little over year off for her second kid and then returned to better position than she had before it was win win for her she got to spend time with her son leave job that kind of sucked and then in the end get better job you do you and eff those people you are more than housewife also housewife is not an easy job you work with the most impatient kind of rude but also wonderful being ever your boss is ruthless because children are more demanding than many jobs ever will be whoa agree with lot of what you said but my kids are being raised by me even though they go to daycare that was shitty statement to make gon na give you the benefit of the doubt and assume you meant my son is being raised by his parents and doesn have to go to daycare this is part of the problem and judgement working moms face from sahm it is an attitude that needs to change it depressingly similar in the uk too ve been stay at home mom for about ten years now find it very fulfilling love my girls and love being there for them before and after school the first one to sign up for field trips any book fair or school event able to be there mean yes it sacrifice only having one income but think it worth it not bored this time in my life is dedicated to my kids and there nothing wrong with that my main job is to be mother and love it think after ten years people have stopped asking me what do all day because it so rude don judge or have anything against working moms at all like that same respect when it comes to my life hence the patriarchy removed removed you can show her you re strong enough to make your own choices the freedom to choose to do what you want to do this is exactly my situation wish more than anything that could stay home at least until my daughter starts school but am primary breadwinner think we make stay at home moms feel bad as op said but we also make working moms feel bad for not being there for their kids having daycare nanny relatives raise them etc it not stay at home mom shaming it just mom shaming in general because baby totally understands women rolls in our culture *eye roll* no one really said anything like that to me but often feel ashamed to tell people just sahm and shamefully quit during my maternity leave to avoid seeing co workers think the phrase staying home just has lazy connotation you typed up my exact feelings especially the inadequate pumping space and unflexibke schedules its so hard do understand the condescension about it at all and working mom very much feel that every family should do what right for them and unfortunately no matter the choice you make there will always be someone there to judge you for it it something that learning is never ending battle as parent constantly defending your choices as mom that all being said the only working mother out of my siblings so far and will admit get damn tired of hearing my sisters tell me about how being sahm is just as challenging as being working mom think it more challenging in the sense that they are in mom mode 24 and do get the social outlet do but get lot of judgement when wo devote time to the things they want me to like showing up for birthday parties and such you know what own business my husband works full time is currently going through incredibly time consuming training to be firefighter and have to still squeak time in to get groceries clean my house do laundry etc so no you do have it just as hard as do have to do all those things and still find time to spend with my child you have massive freedom with time by being home all day that simply do not guess what trying to say is wish sahm like my sisters would appreciate the opportunity they have rather than trying to compare and equate it to my experience edit maybe got tad hypocritical and judgey there guess got some hang ups sahm and that was the choice we made constantly get the oh well could never do that from working moms did know if would be happy doing it but enjoy it for the most part it very thankless 24 job most of the time but only get stressed out about it sometimes think many people equate staying at home as very old school thing women are in the workforce now they do need to be baby making machines who stay at home with the kids while the husband makes money and brings home the bacon think men also get judged when they decide to stay home as well because it is masculine thing guess also thing some of the judgement comes from jealousy because having the ability to stay at home and take care of child or children is sometimes luxury and many people do have the stability to do so also want to add that it is difficult to get back in the workforce after being stay at home parent but there are companies who are making it lot easier think people feel like you are just throwing away your career which is always the case that is insensitive people say shitty things sometimes agree my son went and my daughter goes to daycare as daycare is by far the more financially interesting choice where live reduced my working hours to 80 pct to keep some amount of sanity but that as far as we can go without potentialy compromising long term financial stability still take offence when people claim letting daycare raise my children daycare is there to wake up in the middle of the night or when they are ill plus they are completely closed for minimum to weeks year which gives rise to the eternal struggle for vacation time at work working extra hours to save up more vacation days in fact there are 168 hours in week of which they only spend 36 to 40 max away from me they only eat out of 21 meals week while there do their laundry provide all the things they need actively spend every second can with them while they are awake and not in daycare kindergarten either feeding bathing and most off all playing with them they then have my undivided attention to make up for lost time and bond and so does my husband more important is that training skills like eating and drinking independently manners discipline and potty training only work when you work together with the daycare it not like you get free pass on those things it even only makes it harder as they may be less strict or consequent at the daycare because of all the other kids there my husband and raise our kids together daycare looks after them when we have to work to ensure they have house food clothes and education when they are older which is also part of taking care of them good for you if you are able to stay at home but that alone does make you better parent we all do what we think is best for our kids yeah more than housewives indeed stay at home with my toddlers and the job description is actually full time housekeeper plus full time kid care and no one seems to understand how you can do both all of the time there no way to interact attend fully to kids if you are cleaning *all* of the time yet feel expected to do just that often get advice that amounts to just put them in front of the tv so you can get some more cleaning done sorry if sounded harsh or judgemental that was not my intention just believe every mom or dad should have the ability to stay home if they want to for at least the first year of birth via parental leave system personally could not imagine leaving my baby at weeks in daycare setting like lot of mothers are forced to do if we re sahm my house would be spotless and have dinner ready every night my friend two months after my daughter was born damn want to live at your friends house if that is the case went back to work when my lo was 4mo and quit to stay home with her at 6mo just missed her too much and was making less than daycare cost so it was good move for us will never regret all the snuggles stayed home for even if it makes finding job harder when she starts school think the people who say stuff like that are the people who have done it every stay at home mum knows what it like to do everything or attempt to do everything then have your efforts belittled in single sentence what did you do all day it not that they re being deliberately condescending it just that they do know any better can agree more moms get shamed by others and feel guilty no matter what choice you make might as well do what pleases you and what best for you and your fam that something someone without kid would say they just don get it or has yet to experience it one of my guy friends old co worker after told him am staying home with my son for bit and can get anything done at home he said oh would just put him in play pen to play and can get so many home projects done with all that time my eyes can roll back far enough removed as someone who has worked with infants for nearly years and now have year old of my own can completely back you on this before having my own thought was so prepared and in some ways have been had taken care of babies on my own many many times so one would be too bad but did account for all the little things that really make someone parent the baths the nail clippings the truly sleepless nights the hours of dicing up food into non choking hazard sizes and lord almighty the decisions from big ones to little ones like what for breakfast and lunch and dinner it easily overwhelming daycare can be great loving environment for your lo if you choose or are forced to work but the amount of work put in to just one child is nothing compared to the amount of energy being the parent involves similar in canada as well yessss being an at home mom is fantastic decision for you and your little one after had our first daughter stayed at home for years before returning to work we are pregnant with our second and am officially an at home mom now and plan on staying that way would never bash someone for their decision to take time off to spend with their child literally about an hour ago posted post and mentioned was an at home mom had people bashing me for that it was ridiculous they told me was setting bad example for my kids and that it was not the right thing to do was like really mom shaming bashing get so old you do what you got ta do and be proud of it being at home with your children is the best thing you can do for your children if you choose to go back to work that awesome too am in the same boat it rough sometimes trying to figure out how to handle that awkward moment when my friends say things about work or make comments about how stay at home and do do anything it hurtful at home raising my children is what doing all day get looked down on lot
